summary: This document is a chain of emails from March-April 2020 between Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York's 'SONY Epstein team'. The emails coordinate calls to discuss updates and the views of Allred's clients, who are presumably victims in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Prominent attorney from the firm Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, communicating with the SDNY prosecution team about scheduling calls and discussing her clients' views regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, part of the 'SONY Epstein team', initiating contact with Gloria Allred to provide updates and discuss her clients.

connections.description: Attorney-prosecutor communication regarding the Epstein case, specifically coordinating calls to discuss updates and the views of Allred's clients.
Allred is representing clients who are subjects of discussion with the SDNY prosecution team, indicating they are likely victims or witnesses in the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Call Request
events.description: The SDNY prosecutor emails Gloria Allred requesting a call to provide an update and discuss some of her clients.

events.title: Follow-up Call
events.description: A call takes place between the SDNY team and Gloria Allred, after which the prosecutor follows up via email.

events.title: Scheduled Conference Call
events.description: Allred and the SDNY team schedule a conference call for 4 PM EST, with Allred indicating one of her clients wishes to speak directly with the prosecution.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York had an active 'SONY Epstein team' prosecuting the case as of March 2020.
Prominent victims' rights attorney Gloria Allred was in communication with the SDNY prosecution team regarding her clients involved in the Epstein case.
The prosecution was seeking to understand the views and reactions of Allred's clients and was open to speaking with them directly.
Communication indicates ongoing legal coordination between victim representation and federal prosecutors well after Epstein's death.
